post: Monday Greetings! There's always a bright side. While Mondays don't rate high in polls, they do offer us a fresh start to the new week. May the week ahead be a good one!

How liberating it is to pursue wholeness instead of perfection.
Some days are better, some days are worse. Look for the blessing instead of the curse. Be positive, stay strong, and get enough rest. You can't do it all... But you can do your best.

Always choose love, this is truly what makes us beautiful.

""Some people love a busy life. I prefer the quietness with a good book, cozy fire, and a warm coffee."" ~ This describes many of us. There's also those who are always running somewhere. It's one thing to be adventurous but perhaps home life is lacking too. That's life!

Hello, Tuesday! A fantasy-like breakfast image here. A yogurt and milk container, all perfectly coordinated. Today many make a mad dash in the morning. Families enjoying a weekday breakfast together - perhaps a thing of the past. ""Breakfast: The most important meal of the day.""

Hello, Sunday! There's a saying floating around given the new year that says, ""One Day or Day One, you decide."" In life we can make firm commitments or we can be wishy-washy about them. An easy one for today: Make it a Lazy Sunday! Peace!
Stay strong during your difficult time because darkness can only last for so long. Never lose hope because the light you have been searching for is closer than you think.
Never regret a day in your life. Good days give happiness, bad days give experience, worst days give lessons, and the best days give memories.
Close the chapter of 2025 with a s mile and reflection. Allow excitement, peace, love, and joy welcome you into 2026.
""The year end brings no greater pleasure than the opportunity to express season's greetings and good wishes.""
The old hourglass for 2025 is almost out of sand. While we always hope for the best, what's true is it's out with the old and in with the new. Good luck to us all!

Things worth getting rid of! ~ If you must know New Year's Eve/New Year's Day are not among my fav holidays. I don't think I'm alone. While we can seek to improve ourselves any day of the year, a new year can provide motivation to those who need it.

Tuesday Greetings! We're reminded to enjoy the little things. Throw blankets fit the category. ""Wrap yourself in the small joys - soft blankets, warm drinks and gentle moments.""
Every experience, no matter how bad it seems, holds within it a blessing of some kind. The goal is to find it. Blessing to you always!
Sometimes bravery looks like picking up the phone. Or telling the truth. Or laughing with tears still on your cheeks. Brave is brave. ~ One foot in front of the other.

Happy Midweek! We're in the hot chocolate time of year. Some are good at making it, others go to a coffee shop to indulge. The Federal Government will reopen today and that will bring smiles and economic relief to many. Let's hope this never happens again. Enjoy your day!

Happy Veteran's Day! November 11 marks the anniversary of the armistice that ended World War I on the ""eleventh hour of the eleventh day of the eleventh month"" in 1918. On this November 11th federal holiday, we thank all veterans for their service! üá∫üá∏

Hello Saturday, weekend & November! This image captures the moment well. In many places, November means a lot of falling leaves. Quotes about falling leaves are often about change, beauty, and letting go. Nature is motivating. Have a great day & new month!

140 years ago, on the 12th of September 1885, Arbroath F.C. defeated Bon Accord F.C. 36 to 0 in the first round of the Scottish Cup. It remains the largest margin of victory in an unrigged first-class #football match. Bon Accord was only a year old at the time of the match. üóÉÔ∏è #otd
